name: stomped
content:

past simple and past participle of
stomp
[ I usually + adv/prep ] to walk with intentionally heavy steps, especially as a way of showing that you are annoyed: She stomped up the stairs and slammed her bedroom door. He woke up in a bad mood and stomped off to the bathroom.
[ I or T ] US (UK stamp) to put a foot down on the ground hard and quickly, making a loud noise, often to show anger: The little boy was stomping his foot and refusing to take his medicine. She stood by the road, stomping her feet to stay warm. I wish those people upstairs would stop stomping around. Why did you stomp on that insect?
